tutorial_text.text:
THE POSTURE SYSTEM

The posture system is a concept that measures the opponent's "exhaustion".

When the opponent's posture is raised to full, they are vulnerable in some way, whether to basic attacks or a critical blow.

Most combat interactions with the opponent, defensive or offensive, increases their posture.

The opponent's posture will start to reduce if they are idle and have not weathered a posture-damaging action for a short time.



POSTURE RECOVERY

While the opponent attacks their posture will not decrease, but if they are standing idle they will eventually start to recover.

Attacks, blocks, etc. cause a brief period of posture recovery pause.

To ensure that the progress made in building enemy posture is not lost, it is critical to maintain consistent pressure.



The rate of enemy posture regen is cut if the opponent has sustained some health damage.

This regen penalty applies every quarter of their health drained.

Although posture itself is key to dealing enough damage, managing to chip some in through other means is still helpful.
